medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Xanthomas on fingers, elbows, knees, and buttocks since age 5. Symptoms progressed with the development of wrist, elbow, and knee joint pain. Xanthomas improved and became less rigid following therapy, with pain gradually resolving over time.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diagnosis of homozygous sitosterolemia confirmed by genetic analysis in 2001 due to ABCG5 mutations. Previous therapies included dietary therapy and medications for sitosterol level management.
medical_history.family_history: Father and sister had rare double heterozygous mutations associated with familial hypercholesterolemia and sitosterolemia.
